Driver:  WTP 2.0 RC1 200705241855

Tomcat driver:  Tomcat 6.0.10

I was trying to publish some HTML and servlet on Tomcat 6.0.  While stopping and starting the server manually, I got the following errors in the server console:

SEVERE: IOException while saving persisted sessions: java.io.FileNotFoundException: D:\eclipse33m7\eclipse\runtime-wtp20_0528a\.metadata\.plugins\org.eclipse.wst.server.core\tmp0\work\Catalina\localhost\tc60b\SESSIONS.ser (The system cannot find the path specified.)
java.io.FileNotFoundException: D:\eclipse33m7\eclipse\runtime-wtp20_0528a\.metadata\.plugins\org.eclipse.wst.server.core\tmp0\work\Catalina\localhost\tc60b\SESSIONS.ser (The system cannot find the path specified.)
	at java.io.FileOutputStream.open(Native Method)
	at java.io.FileOutputStream.<init>(FileOutputStream.java:205)
	at java.io.FileOutputStream.<init>(FileOutputStream.java:96)
	at org.apache.catalina.session.StandardManager.doUnload(StandardManager.java:489)
	at org.apache.catalina.session.StandardManager.unload(StandardManager.java:463)
	at org.apache.catalina.session.StandardManager.stop(StandardManager.java:667)
	at org.apache.catalina.core.StandardContext.stop(StandardContext.java:4498)
	at org.apache.catalina.core.StandardContext.reload(StandardContext.java:3077)
	at org.apache.catalina.loader.WebappLoader.backgroundProcess(WebappLoader.java:404)
	at org.apache.catalina.core.ContainerBase.backgroundProcess(ContainerBase.java:1279)
	at org.apache.catalina.core.ContainerBase$ContainerBackgroundProcessor.processChildren(ContainerBase.java:1571)
	at org.apache.catalina.core.ContainerBase$ContainerBackgroundProcessor.processChildren(ContainerBase.java:1580)
	at org.apache.catalina.core.ContainerBase$ContainerBackgroundProcessor.processChildren(ContainerBase.java:1580)
	at org.apache.catalina.core.ContainerBase$ContainerBackgroundProcessor.run(ContainerBase.java:1560)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:799)

This appears to be the expected error that occurs when you remove a project from a running Tomcat server and it is auto-published.  The Tomcat support doesn't really support adding and removing projects from a live server.  This error occurs because removal of certain files triggers a context reload.  Because removal in WTP 2.0 also includes deleting the "work" directory, it doesn't exist when Tomcat tries to persist session data when the contexts is shutdown as part of restarting the context.

I will at least try to address this in the Tomcat FAQ (http://www.eclipse.org/webtools/faq/TomcatServerFAQ.php) when I update it for WTP 2.0.  I worry about resolving this bug at that time.  I'll try to figure out what might be done for WTP 3.0 to better address interacting with a live Tomcat server.
